required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-world CANadian CUvitru Non-Interventional Study in Subjects Transitioning From Subcutaneous Immunoglobulin (CANCUN)
clinical_study.official_title: 24-APR-2020: Real-world CANadian CUvitru Non-Interventional Study in Subjects Transitioning From Subcutaneous Immunoglobulin (CANCUN)

collaborator.agency: Baxalta Innovations GmbH, now part of Shire

brief_summary.textblock: This study will provide insights on the infusion parameters, dosing, and experience of participants transitioning to CUVITRU in a real-world setting.

detailed_description.textblock: 24-APR-2020: Enrollment of new patients into this study has been paused due to the COVID-19 situation. The duration of this pause is dependent on the leveling and control of the COVID-19 pandemic.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication-9 (TSQM-9): Cohort 1
secondary_outcome.description: TSQM-9 is a 9-item, validated, self-administered instrument used to assess participant's satisfaction with medication. The three domains assessed are effectiveness, convenience, and global satisfaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication-9 (TSQM-9): Cohort 2
secondary_outcome.description: TSQM-9 is a 9-item, validated, self-administered instrument used to assess participant's satisfaction with medication. The three domains assessed are effectiveness, convenience, and global satisfaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Life Quality Index (LSI): Cohort 1
secondary_outcome.description: The LQI is a self-administered questionnaire developed specifically for participants/legal guardians involved in IVIG treatments. It consists of 15-items, divided into four domains: treatment interferences (6 items), therapy-related problems (4 items), therapy setting (3 items), and treatment costs (2 items). Items are rated on a 7-point Likert-type scale ranging from 1: "Extremely bad" to 7: "Extremely good". Total scores range from 15 to 105, with higher scores indicating the highest possible satisfaction with factors such as independence, therapy convenience, social/school/work activities, and health and travel costs

secondary_outcome.measure: Life Quality Index (LSI): Cohort 2
secondary_outcome.description: The LQI is a self-administered questionnaire developed specifically for participants/legal guardians involved in IVIG treatments. It consists of 15-items, divided into four domains: treatment interferences (6 items), therapy-related problems (4 items), therapy setting (3 items), and treatment costs (2 items). Items are rated on a 7-point Likert-type scale ranging from 1: "Extremely bad" to 7: "Extremely good". Total scores range from 15 to 105, with higher scores indicating the highest possible satisfaction with factors such as independence, therapy convenience, social/school/work activities, and health and travel costs

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Preference Questionnaire: Cohort 1
secondary_outcome.description: The TPQ is a self-administered questionnaire developed to assess participants' preference towards the administration of new subcutaneous immunoglobulin G (SCIG) therapy. There are 4-items on the questionnaire, which investigate a participant's preference on the clinic/hospital/home setting of receiving the immunoglobulin therapy, the participant's rating on the frequency and method of administration, and the participant's preference to continue receiving the SCIG treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Preference Questionnaire: Cohort 2
secondary_outcome.description: The TPQ is a self-administered questionnaire developed to assess participants' preference towards the administration of new subcutaneous immunoglobulin G (SCIG) therapy. There are 4-items on the questionnaire, which investigate a participant's preference on the clinic/hospital/home setting of receiving the immunoglobulin therapy, the participant's rating on the frequency and method of administration, and the participant's preference to continue receiving the SCIG treatment.

arm_group.description: Cohort 2 will include participants who transitioned to CUVITRU at the study initiation (the first CUVITRU administration is at the study start)
Cohort 2 will include participants 6 months (±2 weeks) after CUVITRU initiation.

study_pop.textblock: Data will be collected on approximately 500 participants with primary immunodeficiency (PID) and secondary immunodeficiency (SID) requiring Immunoglobulin G (IgG) replacement therapy across 8-10 sites in Canada (excluding Quebec). Any specific number of participants in each cohort is not a requirement.

patient_data.ipd_description: Shire provides access to the de-identified individual participant data for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives. These IPDs will be provided following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.shiretrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
